intro: Amaryllis vittata subsp. guarapuavae, commonly known as the Guarapuava amaryllis, is a rare and endemic species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and strap-like, often forming a dense rosette. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
